docs.lead_paragraph: Since my last column referred to the tragedy unfolding in Somalia -- the worst humanitarian crisis in the world right now -- the following news item from Reuters today caught my eye:
docs.abstract: Since my last column referred to the tragedy unfolding in Somalia - the worst humanitarian crisis in the world right now - the following news item from Reuters today caught my eye: KISMAYU, SOMALIA - Somali Islamists have stoned to death a woman accused of adultery in the first such public killing by the militants [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Sex | Why no conservative uproar over Bristol Palin's pregnancy? An article finds high rates of evangelical teen pregnancy (the kids are less likely to use contraception). But as long as a girl doesn't abort, red-state families are "relatively unruffled" by the pregnancy. In blue states, by contrast, teen sex and contraception are tolerated, but pregnancy is stigmatized. [New Yorker]
docs.abstract: Sex | Why no conservative uproar over Bristol Palin's pregnancy? An article finds high rates of evangelical teen pregnancy (the kids are less likely to use contraception). But as long as a girl doesn't abort, red-state families are "relatively unruffled" by the pregnancy. In blue states, by contrast, teen sex and contraception are tolerated, but pregnancy is stigmatized. [New Yorker]

docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (Oxygen) COOLIO'S RULES Coolio, above, the Grammy Award-winning rapper and actor, takes a break from life on the road to raise his four children (Artisha and Brandi, 20; Artis, 18; and Jackie, 15) as a single father, find love and make a few bucks on the side as the overseer of a family catering business -- all while using what Oxygen is calling ''irreverent methods of discipline.'' He also promotes his new album, ''Steal Hear,'' alongside Artis, who, like his father, has a way with words. 9 A.M. (CBS) THE DOCTORS The experts discuss measles vaccinations, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, and pregnancy symptoms after tubal ligation.

docs.lead_paragraph: These days, there are social networks for everyone, from high school athletes to dog lovers. It is hard to believe that many of these niche networks will thrive -- do teenage football players really need their own Web site or will general social networks like Facebook serve them just as well?
docs.abstract: Do people want to chat about their health online?
docs.snippet: Do people want to chat about their health online?

docs.lead_paragraph: Fable II, a new role-playing game from Microsoft for the Xbox 360, is a thoroughly insightful piece of entertainment wrapped in a colorful, almost deceptively simple package.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congratulations to Dawn Meehan, whose blog, "Because I Said So" was named "Best Parenting Blog" by the voters in the 2008 Blogger's Choice Awards. I first started reading Dawn a little over a year ago, after being hooked on the post that launched her blogging career  this cackle-aloud account of a grocery shopping trip with her six children.
docs.abstract: Wondering whether to go from one to two, two to three, or two to six, even.
docs.snippet: Wondering whether to go from one to two, two to three, or two to six, even.
